config.help: Batch size used for running YOLO predictions. Larger batch sizes can provide higher throughput.
Minimum confidence threshold for detections. Objects detected with confidence below this threshold will be disregarded.
Computation device for PyTorch (e.g. 'cpu', '0' for GPU).
Enable or disable debug mode to display additional logs and diagnostic information.
Total number of complete training passes through the entire dataset.
Use higher value to get sharper, less detailed contours.
Path to the YOLO model file to be used as the starting point for training (pretrained weights or a custom checkpoint).
Path to a JSON manifest (a JSON array of image filenames) used as a whitelist. If empty, all images are considered.
Remove contours smaller than this area (pixels²); raise it to suppress speckles and debris.
Minimum number of points required to keep a polygon.
Function used to calculate weighted confidence scores. Can be a positive integer or 'log'
Print contours as in publication style.
Target size (in pixels) for training images.
Path to the folder containing the training image files or the images to predict
Thresholding strategy: {auto, otsu, isodata, yen, li, triangle} or numeric (percentile <1, absolute ≥1). ‘auto’ selects Otsu or Triangle based on skewness.
Target number of points per polygon.
Fraction of the dataset to reserve for validation during training (value between 0 and 1).
JSON list of class-name pairs allowed to overlap.
Path to the YAML file used to resolve class names.
